intro: Chaenorhinum glareosum, commonly known as the yellow horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow petals and distinctive horn-shaped seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes other poppy species. Its botanical features make it a notable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
